title: Add pre-flight check for Windows install issues
description: Detect product key prompts or stuck installations BEFORE 10-minute timeout. Check container logs for specific error patterns.

title: Run 20-50 task evaluation
description: Run WAA benchmark on 20-50 tasks to measure baseline success rate. Target is >80% success rate. This provides quantitative data on agent performance.

title: Implement permanent fix for Windows unattended install
Analyze evaluation results
description: Analyze WAA evaluation results to identify failure modes, success patterns, and improvement opportunities. Document findings and create actionable next steps.

title: Implement permanent fix for Windows unattended install
description: ROOT CAUSE FOUND: Using dev mode (UNC paths \\host.lan\Data) instead of Azure mode (C:\oem). Dev mode had UNC escaping bug in patch_xml.py. FIX: Simplified Dockerfile using vanilla WAA Azure mode approach - native OEM mechanism, no samba.sh patching, no custom FirstLogonCommands.

title: Complete WAA validation
description: Validate that the WAA benchmark setup works end-to-end. Run a single task to confirm the infrastructure is operational before scaling up to full evaluation.
notes:
2026-01-22: Attempted end-to-end live smoke run on Azure VM.

- Command: uv run python -m openadapt_evals.benchmarks.cli smoke-live --vm-name waa-eval-vm --resource-group OPENADAPT-AGENTS --task-id notepad_1
- VM start + public IP succeeded (172.171.112.41)
- Blocker: az vm run-command invoke timed out while running 'docker start winarena' (container start never returned)
- Result: WAA server never became reachable on :5000; live eval could not connect
- Cleanup: VM deallocated at end to stop spend

Next: run remote docker diagnostics (docker ps -a, docker logs winarena, systemctl status docker, disk space) and fix underlying image/container hang (likely winarena pull/extract / docker stuck).

title: Docker installation fails on Azure VM - pkgProblemResolver error
description: vm setup-waa fails to install Docker. Error: pkgProblemResolver::Resolve generated breaks. Need to investigate root cause before attempting fix.

title: SYSTEM: Create knowledge persistence workflow using Beads
description:
Every fix/approach must be logged as a Beads issue with:
1. Problem description
2. Attempted solution
3. Result (worked/failed/partial)
4. Root cause if known
5. Files changed

Before any fix attempt, agent MUST:
1. Run 'bd list --labels=fix,approach' to see prior attempts
2. Review what was tried before
3. Document new attempt BEFORE implementing

After context compaction, first action:
1. Run 'bd ready' for current tasks
2. Run 'bd list --labels=recurring' for known recurring issues
3. Check docs/RECURRING_ISSUES.md for patterns

title: Test simplified Dockerfile (Azure mode)
description: Testing Dockerfile.simplified which uses vanilla WAA Azure mode: native OEM mechanism (C:\oem), InstallFrom element for unattended install, VERSION=11e for no product key. Steps: 1) Delete current VM 2) Create fresh VM 3) Build simplified image 4) Test Windows installation via QEMU screenshots
notes:
2026-01-22: Confirmed the blocker is not just docker pull; even starting the existing 'winarena' container via az vm run-command timed out.

- smoke-live tried to run docker start winarena via run-command and timed out (900s)
- WAA server remained unreachable at http://172.171.112.41:5000
- VM was deallocated after the attempt

Implication: VM/docker state is unhealthy or container start is hanging (possibly due to incomplete image extraction / stuck daemon / disk pressure).
Next: add/run a vm-debug command to capture docker/system logs and determine whether to rebuild VM/image, pin/mirror image (ACR), or adjust docker config.

title: RCA: Windows product key prompt recurring issue
close_reason: RCA complete - root cause is VERSION mismatch (CLI=11, Dockerfile=11e). Fix documented in RECURRING_ISSUES.md and WINDOWS_PRODUCT_KEY_RCA.md

title: Add pre-flight check to detect Windows install issues
